overview: The purpose of this measure is to "satisfy several claims against the State, its officers, or its employees" (HB990_CD1_CCR132_.HTM.txt). This bill makes appropriations for fiscal year 2024-2025 for "payments of judgments or settlements, or other liabilities" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). All unexpended balances from these appropriations "as of the close of business on June 30, 2026, shall lapse" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt).
appropriations: The measure appropriates a total of $7,023,343.07 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the "general revenues of the State of Hawaii" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for various judgments and settlements. It also appropriates $1,320,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from "the state highway fund" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for claims against the Department of Transportation, Highways Division. A final appropriation of $90,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) is made from "judiciary funds" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for a claim against the Judiciary.
policy_impact: The measure declares that the appropriations will cause the "general fund expenditure ceiling for fiscal year 2024-2025 to be further exceeded by $7,023,343.07 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt), or one per cent" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). The reason provided for exceeding the ceiling is that "the appropriations made in this Act are necessary to serve the public interest and to meet the needs addressed by this Act" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). The Conference Committee also amended the measure by "Changing the effective date to upon approval" (HB990_CD1_CCR132_.HTM.txt).
revenue_sources: Appropriations are made from three separate sources for fiscal year 2024-2025. The legislative document specifies that $7,023,343.07 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) is appropriated "out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). An additional $1,320,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) is appropriated "out of the state highway fund" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt), and $90,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) is appropriated "out of the judiciary funds" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt).
six_year_fiscal_implications: The legislative document specifies appropriations for fiscal year 2024-2025 to satisfy numerous claims. From general revenues, these include miscellaneous claims totaling $1,021,738.39 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt); $28,500.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for a Department of the Attorney General claim; $100,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for a Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation claim; and $280,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for Department of Defense claims. The Department of Education has claims totaling $2,645,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt), including a settlement for Brenda Persinger for $1,750,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). Further general fund appropriations include $400,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for a Department of Hawaiian Home Lands claim; $348,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for Department of Health claims; $512,700.83 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for a Department of Human Services judgment; $834,771.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for Department of Land and Natural Resources claims; $750,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for a Department of Law Enforcement settlement; $32,632.85 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for a Department of Taxation settlement; and $70,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for a Judiciary settlement. From the state highway fund, $1,320,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for three settlements, including $1,075,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) for Juan Jimmie Aldeguer v. State of Hawaii. From judiciary funds, $90,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for the settlement of Leanne Rosa v. Randal G.B. Valenciano.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: These appropriations are for one-time payments of judgments and settlements. According to the legislative document, "All unexpended and unencumbered balances of the appropriations made in this Act as of the close of business on June 30, 2026, shall lapse" (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). There are no ongoing fiscal obligations after this date.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The Conference Committee has amended the measure to finalize the claims and appropriation amounts. The total appropriation is now specified from three distinct funds: $7,023,343.07 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from general funds, $1,320,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the state highway fund, and $90,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt) from judiciary funds. Several claim amounts differ from those previously requested in testimony, including a settlement for Jon R. Chung for $50,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt), a settlement for Kamaka Air, LLC for $298,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt), a judgment for John Roe No. 121 for $512,700.83 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt), and a settlement for Anela Aplaca for $115,000.00 (HB990_CD1_.HTM.txt). The final bill adds numerous other claims not mentioned in the previous testimony and includes a formal declaration that the general fund appropriation will exceed the expenditure ceiling.
